channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Suspect in Russian General’s Killing Detained Outside of Moscow
item.description: The Russian prosecutor’s office said the suspect, a 29-year-old citizen of Uzbekistan, confessed to planting the bomb on the orders of Ukrainian agent...

item.title: Al-Assad’s Soldiers Hope for Amnesty. First, They Have to Take a Number.
item.description: Syria’s new rulers say they will spare conscripts of Bashar al-Assad and pursue those who oversaw his regime’s abuses. Hundreds are lining up to learn...

item.title: Will BYD take over Europe’s struggling EV market?
item.description: European automakers should beware—the world’s largest producer of plug-in cars is Chinese and has plans for European electric domination.

item.title: Fed Expected to Cut Rates, and C.E.O. Shooting Suspect Branded Terrorist
item.description: Plus, a beefy new skin care trend.

item.title: AT&T is dumping hybrid work as it follows Amazon in demanding employees spend 5 days a week in office
item.description: AT&T CEO John Stankey told managers last year they would need to come back to the core office hubs—18,000 returned.

item.title: Inside Disney’s Decision to Settle the Trump Suit Against ABC News

item.title: What to Watch as the Fed Makes Its Final 2024 Rate Decision
item.description: Federal Reserve officials are widely expected to cut interest rates, but investors will focus on hints about what comes next.

item.title: The Year in Pictures 2024: Far From Ordinary
item.description: Photographers captured historic moments of war, grief and wonder that defined the year.

item.title: Who Is Friedrich Merz of Germany?

item.title: Donald Trump’s media company presents a new type of potential conflicts of interest
item.description: Trump media connects the President-elect’s political allies and his business interests in a decidedly 21st century tech company.

item.title: Netflix capitalizes on anxiety-driven millennial nostalgia with Christmas movie formula that’s reviving the careers of former teen stars
item.description: Amidst socioeconomic turmoil, it’s not just the season for holiday movies—it’s the era of them.

item.title: 20 innovative breakthroughs that will transform your health
item.description: We recognize some of the most staggering, game-changing, life-improving developments of the year.

item.title: Tiny Coffins: Measles Is Killing Thousands of Children in Congo
item.description: Problems with getting vaccines to families have left many children unvaccinated and in danger of contracting the virus.
